1{-# LANGUAGE PatternSynonyms #-}
2{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
3
4-- | Text decomposition by subtext.
5--
6-- = Subtext
7--
8--   Subtext is a domain-specific language for text decomposition.
9--   The @subtext@ relmap operator provides the functionality of this language.
10--   In the following descrition, we use a symbol
11--   /E/ for subtext expression,
12--   //P/ for present term name,
13--   //N/ for new term name,
14--   /N/ for symbolic name,
15--   /T/ for text,
16--   /C/ for character (single-letter text).
17--
18-- == Relmap operator
19--
20--   The @subtext@ operator decompose text using subtext expression.
21--   There are two ways for describing expression: single or bundle.
22--
23--   [ subtext /P ( E ) ]
24--     Decompose text content of /\/P/ by single expression /E/.
25--   [ subtext /P { N1 = E1 | N2 = E2 | ... } ]
26--     Decompose text by bundle of named expressions.
27--     Text decomposition starts from /N1/.
28--
29-- == Basic patterns
30--
31--   [ ? ]
32--     Any character.
33--   [ ?? ]
34--     Context-dependent pattern.
35--   [ begin ]
36--     Beginning of text.
37--   [ end ]
38--     End of text.
39--   [ ( E ) ]
40--     Group expression /E/.
41--
42-- == Texts
43--
44--   [ T ]
45--     Text literal as /T/.
46--   [ char T ]
47--     Alternative occurences of characters included in /T/.
48--   [ word T ]
49--     Alternative occurences of words included in /T/.
50--   [ cat T ... ]
51--     Characters in the Unicode general categories,
52--     /T/ is one-letter or two-letter category name.
53--     See 'T.categoryLookup'.
54--   [ C1 to C2 ]
55--     Characters betweeen C1 and C2.
56--
57--   [ sp ]
58--     Unicode space character or space-like control character
59--     including tabs (HT\/VT), newlines (CR\/LF), or form feed (FF).
60--     See 'Data.Char.isSpace'.
61--   [ 012 ]
62--     Unicode number character.
63--     See 'T.categoryNumber'.
64--   [ digit ]
65--     ASCII digits.
66--     See 'Data.Char.isDigit'.
67--   [ abc ]
68--     Unicode letter or mark character.
69--     See 'T.categoryLetter' or 'T.categoryMark'.
70--   [ +- ]
71--     Unicode punctuation or symbol character.
72--     See 'T.categoryPunctuation' or 'T.categorySymbol'.
73--   [ open ]
74--     Open punctuations.
75--     See 'T.categoryOpen'.
76--   [ close ]
77--     Close punctuations.
78--     See 'T.categoryClose'.
79--   [ ascii ]
80--     ASCII characters.
81--     See 'Data.Char.isAscii'.
82--   [ latin-1 ]
83--     ISO 8859-1 (Latin-1) characters.
84--     See 'Data.Char.isLatin1'.
85--
86-- == Combinations
87--
88--   [ E1 | E2 ]
89--     Alternative occurence of /E1/ or /E2/.
90--   [ E1 ++ E2 ]
91--     Sequence of /E1/ followed by /E2/.
92--   [ E1 or E2 ]
93--     Alternative occurence of /E1/ or /E2/.
94--   [ E1 and E2 ]
95--     /E1/ and additional condition /E2/.
96--   [ not E ]
97--     Inverted condition.
98--   [ last E ]
99--     Find last /E/.
100--   [ before E ]
101--     Sequence of not /E/.
102--   [ E as T ]
103--     Replace to text /T/ when /E/ is matched.
104--   [ stay E ]
105--     Match /E/ but input position is not changed.
106--
107-- == Repetition
108--
109--   [ { E } ]
110--     Zero-or-more occurences of /E/. (Zero-repeat)
111--   [ { E } ( N ) ]
112--     /N/-times occurences of /E/.
113--   [ { E } ( L to ) ]
114--     Repetition of /E/ with lower bound /L/.
115--   [ { E } ( to U ) ]
116--     Repetition of /E/ with upper bound /U/.
117--   [ { E } ( L to U ) ]
118--     Repetition of /E/ with lower bound /L/ and upper bound /U/.
119--   [ &#x5B; E &#x5D; ]
120--     Zero-or-one occurences of /E/. (Option)
121--   [ {- E -} ]
122--     One-or-more occurences of /E/. (One-repeat)
123--   [ E1 sep E2 ]
124--     /E1/-separated /E2/. (Zero-repeat)
125--
126-- == Gathering subtext
127--
128--   [ /N E ]
129--     Submatch for /E/ whose name is /\/N/.
130--   [ /N ]
131--     Named submatch, equivalent to /\/N/ ??.
132--   [ off E ]
133--     Turn off gathering text in /E/.
134--   [ on E ]
135--     Turn on gathering text in /E/.
136
137module Koshucode.Baala.Rop.Flat.Subtext
138  ( SubtextPara, consSubtext, relmapSubtext, relkitSubtext,
139  ) where
140
141import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base               as B
142import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax             as S
143import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Data               as D
144import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Core               as C
145import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Rop.Base           as Op
146import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Subtext            as T
147import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Rop.Flat.Message   as Msg
148
149
150-- --------------------------------------------  Operator
151
152type SubtextPara = (S.TermName, [T.NameDepth], T.CharMatch, Bool)
153
154consSubtext :: (D.CContent c) => C.RopCons c
155consSubtext med =
156  do term  <- Op.getTerm   med "-term"
157     sub   <- Op.getTrees  med "-subtext"
158     trim  <- Op.getSwitch med "-trim"
159     b     <- parseBundle sub
160     let ns    = T.bundleSubmatch b
161         match = T.matchBundle b
162     Right $ relmapSubtext med (term, ns, match, trim)
163
164relmapSubtext :: (D.CContent c) => C.Intmed c -> SubtextPara -> C.Relmap c
165relmapSubtext med = C.relmapFlow med . relkitSubtext
166
167relkitSubtext :: (D.CContent c) => SubtextPara -> Maybe D.Head -> B.Ab (C.Relkit c)
168relkitSubtext _ Nothing = Right C.relkitNothing
169relkitSubtext (n, ns, match, trim) (Just he1) = Right kit2 where
170    pick    = Op.picker he1 [n]
171    he2     = D.headAppend (fst <$> ns) he1
172    kit2    = C.relkitJust he2 $ C.RelkitOneToOne False f2
173    result  = subtextResult trim ns
174    f2 cs   = case pick cs of
175               [c] | D.isText c
176                   -> case match $ D.gText c of
177                        Just (_, rs) -> result rs ++ cs
178                        Nothing      -> result [] ++ cs
179               _ -> result [] ++ cs
180
181subtextResult :: (D.CEmpty c, D.CText c, D.CList c) =>
182    Bool -> [T.NameDepth] -> [(S.TermName, String)] -> [c]
183subtextResult trim ns rs = result <$> ns where
184    text = D.pText . trimIf trim
185    result (n, depth) =
186        case lookup' n rs of
187          ts | depth > 0  -> D.pList (text <$> ts)
188          t : _           -> text t
189          []              -> D.empty
190
191lookup' :: (Eq a) => a -> [(a, b)] -> [b]
192lookup' n ass = snd <$> filter eq ass where
193    eq (n', _) = n == n'
194
195trimIf :: Bool -> String -> String
196trimIf True  t = B.trimBoth t
197trimIf False t = t
198
199
200-- --------------------------------------------  Parser
201
202-- | Type for subtext bundle.
203type CharBundle = T.Bundle Char
204
205pattern L tok   <- B.TreeL tok
206pattern K n     <- L (Key n)
207pattern T s     <- L (Text s)
208pattern C c     <- L (Char c)
209pattern To      <- K "to"
210
211pattern B g xs  <- B.TreeB g _ xs
212pattern G xs    <- B S.BracketGroup xs
213pattern Empty   <- G []
214
215pattern Key  n  <- S.TTextRaw _ n
216pattern Text t  <- S.TTextQQ  _ t
217pattern Char c  <- S.TTextQQ  _ [c]
218pattern Term n  <- S.TTermN _ _ n
219
220unknownSyntax :: (Show a) => a -> B.Ab b
221unknownSyntax x = Msg.adlib $ "subtext syntax error " ++ show x
222
223unknownBracket :: (Show a) => a -> B.Ab b
224unknownBracket g = Msg.adlib $ "subtext unknown bracket " ++ show g
225
226unknownKeyword :: String -> B.Ab b
227unknownKeyword n = Msg.adlib $ "subtext unknown keyword " ++ n
228
229unknownCategory :: String -> B.Ab b
230unknownCategory n = Msg.adlib $ "subtext unknown general category " ++ n
231
232divide :: String -> S.TTreesTo [[S.TTree]]
233divide s = S.divideTreesBy (== s)
234
235-- | Parse token trees into subtext bundle.
236parseBundle :: [S.TTree] -> B.Ab CharBundle
237parseBundle = bundle where
238    bundle xs@[B S.BracketSet sub] =
239        case step1 `mapM` divide "|" sub of
240          Left _    -> single xs
241          Right nxs -> do let ns = fst <$> nxs
242                          es <- step2 ns `mapM` nxs
243                          Right $ T.bundle es
244    bundle xs = single xs
245
246    single xs = do e <- parseSubtext [] xs
247                   Right $ T.bundle [("start", e)]
248
249    step1 :: [S.TTree] -> B.Ab (String, [S.TTree])
250    step1 xs = case divide "=" xs of
251                 [[K n], x] -> Right (n, x)
252                 _                -> unknownSyntax xs
253
254    step2 :: [String] -> (String, [S.TTree]) -> B.Ab (String, T.CharExpr)
255    step2 ns (n, x) = do e <- parseSubtext ns x
256                         Right (n, e)
257
258-- | Parse token trees into subtext expression.
259parseSubtext :: [String] -> [S.TTree] -> B.Ab T.CharExpr
260parseSubtext ns = trees False where
261
262    -- Trees
263    trees :: Bool -> [S.TTree] -> B.Ab T.CharExpr
264    trees False xs              = opTop xs
265    trees True (K n : xs)       = pre n xs
266    trees True [L (Term n), x]  = Right . T.sub n =<< tree x  -- /N E
267    trees True [L (Term n)]     = Right $ T.sub n T.what      -- /N
268    trees True []               = Right T.succ                -- ()
269    trees True [x]              = tree x
270    trees True  xs              = unknownSyntax $ show xs
271
272    -- Leaf or branch
273    tree :: S.TTree -> B.Ab T.CharExpr
274    tree (L x)        = leaf x
275    tree (B g xs)     = branch g xs
276    tree x            = unknownSyntax x
277
278    leaf :: S.Token -> B.Ab T.CharExpr
279    leaf (Text t)     = Right $ T.equal t     -- "LITERAL"
280    leaf (Key n)      = pre n []
281    leaf x            = unknownSyntax x
282
283    branch :: S.BracketType -> [S.TTree] -> B.Ab T.CharExpr
284    branch S.BracketGroup   = opTop            -- ( E )
285    branch S.BracketSet     = bracket T.many   -- { E }
286    branch S.BracketTie     = bracket T.many1  -- {- E -}
287    branch S.BracketList    = bracket T.maybe  -- [ E ]
288    branch br               = const $ unknownBracket br
289
290    bracket op xs = do e <- trees False xs
291                       Right $ op e
292
293    times :: [S.TTree] -> [S.TTree] -> B.Ab T.CharExpr
294    times [ Empty , To , Empty ] = bracket (T.many)
295    times [ K a   , To         ] = bracket (T.min (int a))
296    times [ K a   , To , Empty ] = bracket (T.min (int a))
297    times [         To , K b   ] = bracket (T.max (int b))
298    times [ Empty , To , K b   ] = bracket (T.max (int b))
299    times [ K a   , To , K b   ] = bracket (T.minMax (int a) (int b))
300    times [ K a                ] = bracket (T.minMax (int a) (int a))
301    times xs = const $ unknownSyntax $ show xs
302
303    int s = case B.readInt s of
304              Just n   -> n
305              Nothing  -> error "require integer"
306
307    -- Infix operators
308    opTop :: [S.TTree] -> B.Ab T.CharExpr
309    opTop [B S.BracketSet xs, G m] = times m xs
310    opTop xs = opAlt xs
311    opAlt    = inf "|"   T.or    opSeq   -- E | E | E
312    opSeq    = inf "++"  T.seq   opOr    -- E ++ E ++ E
313    opOr     = inf "or"  T.or    opAnd   -- E or E or E
314    opAnd    = inf "and" T.and   opSep   -- E and E and E
315
316    inf op f g xs = Right . f =<< mapM g (divide op xs)
317
318    opSep xs = case divide "sep" xs of  -- E sep E
319                 [sep, v] -> do ev   <- trees False v
320                                esep <- trees False sep
321                                Right $ T.sep esep ev
322                 [xs2]    -> opAs xs2
323                 _        -> unknownSyntax xs
324
325    opAs xs = case divide "as" xs of    -- E as E
326                 [xs2, [T to]] -> do e <- trees False xs2
327                                     Right $ T.asConst to e
328                 [xs2]         -> opTo xs2
329                 _             -> unknownSyntax xs
330
331    opTo xs = case divide "to" xs of    -- C to C
332                 [[C fr], [C to]] -> Right $ T.to fr to
333                 [xs2]            -> trees True xs2  -- Turn on loop check
334                 _                -> unknownSyntax xs
335
336    -- Prefix operators
337    pre n [] | n `elem` ns  = Right $ T.change n
338
339    pre "?"       []        = Right T.any
340    pre "??"      []        = Right T.what
341    pre "begin"   []        = Right T.begin
342    pre "end"     []        = Right T.end
343    pre "digit"   []        = Right T.digit
344    pre "ascii"   []        = Right T.ascii
345    pre "latin-1" []        = Right T.latin1
346    pre "sp"      []        = Right T.space
347    pre "012"     []        = Right $ T.categoryList T.categoryNumber
348    pre "abc"     []        = Right $ T.categoryList T.categoryAlpha
349    pre "+-"      []        = Right $ T.categoryList T.categorySign
350    pre "open"    []        = Right $ T.categoryList T.categoryOpen
351    pre "close"   []        = Right $ T.categoryList T.categoryClose
352
353    pre "char"   [T s]      = Right $ T.char s             -- char T
354    pre "word"   [T s]      = Right $ T.word s             -- word T
355    pre "not"    [x]        = Right . T.not    =<< tree x  -- not E
356    pre "last"   [x]        = Right . T.last   =<< tree x  -- last E
357    pre "before" [x]        = Right . T.before =<< tree x  -- before E
358    pre "stay"   [x]        = Right . T.stay   =<< tree x  -- stay E
359    pre "on"     [x]        = Right . T.gather =<< tree x  -- on E
360    pre "off"    [x]        = Right . T.skip   =<< tree x  -- off E
361    pre "cat"    xs         = do ks <- keyword `mapM` xs   -- cat T
362                                 case T.category $ unwords ks of
363                                   Right e -> Right e
364                                   Left n  -> unknownCategory n
365    pre n _                 = unknownKeyword n
366
367    keyword (K s)           = Right s
368    keyword x               = unknownSyntax x
369
